title: Singer Zubeen Garg's family to take final call on cremation site: Assam Minister

title: Actor Mohanlal dedicates Dadasaheb Phalke Award to Malayalam film industry

title: Russia-Ukraine war, volatile coal markets driving up electricity costs in India: study
content: The risk premiums are significantly higher during peak hours (6 to 11 p.m.) and rise by up to 13% on weekends, reflecting severe power supply shortages.

title: GST rate cut kicks in from September 22, goods and services to become cheaper
content: About 99% of goods under the 12% GST slab currently will move to 5%. The rejig will also result in 90% items under 28% tax slab coming down to 18% bracket

title: Declared ‘stateless,’ litigant approaches Madras High Court 34 years after being born, raised in India by Sri Lankan parents
content: Justice M. Dhandapani restrains the Centre and Tamil Nadu Government from taking coercive action against him and wants to know the status of his application for naturalisation

title: Kurmi agitators lift blockade from all but 2 rail stations post Centre's assurance of talks
content: “The agitation at Sini will be withdrawn soon, while it will continue at Pradhan Khanta until the date for the meeting is allotted by the Centre,” Kurmi Vikas Morcha central president said

title: PM Modi to visit Arunachal, Tripura on September 22, lay foundation stones of two hydropower projects in Itanagar
content: PM Modi will visit Tripura and perform a puja and 'darshan', and inaugurate the development work of 'Mata Tripura Sundari Temple Complex' at Matabari

title: Two-wheeler rider injured in wild elephant attack in Thiruvananthapuram
content: Doctors at the local taluk hospital were treating 48-year-old Jithendran for multiple bone injuries, including a few broken ribs

content: Deputy Chief Minister K. Pawan Kalyan congratulated Mohanlal on being chosen for the Dadasaheb Phalke award

title: BJP claims abuses again hurled at PM Modi's mother, this time during Tejashwi Yadav's 'Bihar Adhikar Yatra'
content: Sharing a video of the purported incident on X, Deputy CM Samrat Choudhary wrote, “Tejashwi Yadav has once again insulted Modi ji’s late mother. He has once again torn apart the culture of Bihar”

title: Police station in Jharkhand’s Ranchi district vandalised; officer injured in mob attack
content: The incident took place at Pandra police station when an irate mob barged into the premises, after a person, undergoing treatment at a private hospital after a road accident, succumbed to his injuries

content: Police are also in possession of an audio recording in which the accused can be heard asking for ₹15 lakh from a candidate

title: Three die of electrocution during kabaddi match in Chhattisgarh's Kondagaon
content: A sudden storm caused an 11-kV power line to touch the iron pole of the tent erected on the ground for viewers to watch the game, resulting in several of them receiving an electric shock

title: Aadhaar should be integrated with chips to ensure fair elections: Akhilesh Yadav
content: Mr. Yadav said if the caste census is initiated, reservations will be properly implemented, and the unity and strength of the PDA community will solve people’s problems

content: This is the second event that Tramjatra is conducting this year, in spite of the tram now almost disappearing from Kolkata’s ecosystem

title: ABVP panel sweeps Hyderabad Central University Student Union elections
content: The Congress-affiliated NSUI received fewer votes than NOTA surprising many despite a Congress government ruling the State

title: Singer Zubeen Garg's mortal remains begin final journey home, thousands wait at Guwahati stadium to bid adieu
content: Wailing, 'Why Zubeen da, why did you have to leave us so soon', thousands were seen holding cut-outs of the singer and the traditional Assamese 'gamosa' with the words 'Z G (Zubeen Garg) Forever' woven in it

title: 2 detained in Manipur over ambush on Assam Rifles' convoy
content: “As per preliminary investigation, multiple owners of the said vehicle have been identified, and efforts are still on to uncover more details,” the police statement added

title: Uttarakhand govt to buy produce from apple growers in disaster-hit Dharali
content: Mr. Dhami has issued orders to the State agriculture and farmers' welfare department to implement the announcement immediately

title: It is a settled issue, Nitish Kumar is NDA’s CM Face: JD(U) leader Sanjay K. Jha
content: Ahead of the Bihar Assembly election, Janata Dal (United)’s Working President Sanjay K. Jha asserts that despite nearly 20 years in power there is pro-incumbency for Nitish Kumar, who will remain the NDA’s CM face

title: All-access pass: Chennai rides to the future
content: ‘Chennai One’, a mobile application developed by the Chennai Unified Metropolitan Transport Authority, will allow commuters to use a single QR-code ticket for travelling on Chennai Metro Rail, MTC buses, and suburban trains. It will be launched by Chief Minister M.K. Stalin tomorrow. R. Srikanth and Sunitha Sekar  explain how it was conceived and developed

title: Fare integration is the future forward
content: Transport activists insist that a common fare denomination mechanism will be more attractive for commuters to use public transport

title: Threat to rule of law, says Opposition on Varanasi lawyer-police clashes
content: Uttar Pradesh Congress unit president Ajay Rai demanded the intervention of the Prime Minister, who is also the local MP, to resolve the conflict and stop the harassment of advocates.

title: Delays in repairing roads dug up for gas pipeline irk residents
content: Paruthipattu resident and advocate, V. B. Srinivasan said that gas line work on Avadi – Poonamallee Road was causing traffic jams on a regular basis.

title: Ruckus at Guwahati airport as fans, waiting for Zubeen's mortal remains, break through barricades
content: Similar scenes also unfolded in front of Garg's flat in the Kahilipara area of the city as hundreds gathered there to mourn their beloved artists, blocking the road leading to the apartment block

title: Modi’s visit to Manipur | A Prime Minister’s pit stop for promises
content: In Narendra Modi’s first visit to Manipur after ethnic violence broke out between the minority Kuki-Zo and majority Meitei communities in 2023, up to ₹8,500 crore was announced in investments for the State. The Hindu finds that the PM met with select displaced people, while those he didn’t meet were divided: some said it gave them hope for an end to the conflict; some that investments didn’t necessarily mean peace

title: Is it feasible to blend isobutanol and diesel? | Explained
content: When will the pilot project be completed? Why has ethanol been discarded as the possible alternative? What is the raw material? How is it produced? What are the pros and cons of using this biofuel? Will it have a bearing on ignition and better engine performance?

title: Why is India on the U.S. blacklist on fentanyl? | Explained
content: What are fentanyl precursors? Why is it difficult to monitor the trade? How does the supply chain work?

title: Amoebic meningoencephalitis | Conflated cases
content: Of the 110 cases of AME, only 11 were due to Naegleria fowleri, the ‘brain-eating’ amoeba; almost all of the remaining were cases of encephalitis caused by Acanthamoeba, another free-living amoeba

title: Prashant Kishor has raised hundreds of crores of rupees through shell companies, alleges Bihar BJP
content: More than ₹370 crore have come from West Bengal, where he had worked for Mamata Banerjee's Trinamool Congress in the 2021 assembly polls. Besides, Kishor is getting huge funds from states like Telangana, Tamil Nadu and Karnataka, alleges BJP's state media in-charge Danish Iqbal

title: Postpone socio-educational survey or extend time given: H.D. Kumaraswamy
content: Union Minister H.D. Kumaraswamy has demanded that the socio-educational survey be postponed beyond Dasara or the time given for it be extended

title:
Protests erupt at West Bengal law varsity demanding V-C’s
resignation
content: The Supreme Court had made serious observations against the Vice-Chancellor in a sexual assault allegation

title: Young stars shine bright in this camp for Sri Lankan Tamil refugees near city
content: An exposure visit by industry leaders to the camp, organised by SICCI and the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, highlighted the success stories scripted by its young residents

title: Dasara festival at Srisailam temple to begin on September 22
content: ‘Kainkaryams’ will be performed to the deities as usual; sacred silk robes will be offered on behalf of the government on October 1

title: Kochi water distribution upgrade project awaits govt. sanction
content: The agreement between the KWA and private entity, SUEZ, was inked in June; company will begin work once the advance payment is given, says KWA official

title: PhD scholar found dead in IIT Kharagpur
content: After the researcher’s father could not reach him over the phone, he contacted the institute’s security. His room was found locked following which the institute alerted local police.

title: PDS reforms introduced to reduce diversion and smuggling of ration: A.P. Minister
content: Reforms aimed at ensuring the poor and farmers benefit directly, making PDS not just a welfare scheme but a symbol of dignity, justice, and trust, says Nadendla Manohar

title: Watch: Trump’s H-1B visa order | Explained
content: Employers will now need to pay $100,000 (around ₹83 lakh) annually for each H-1B employee, making renewals a costly decision. The move, officials say, is aimed at ensuring only highly skilled workers are hired while boosting U.S. revenue. For Indian professionals, who make up the majority of H-1B holders, the change raises uncertainty around jobs and green card hopes. A proposed 25% outsourcing tax could add further pressure on India’s $220 billion IT export industry.

title: DMK government achieved in 4 years what the AIADMK could not in a decade: Stalin
content: The Chief Minister says Gross State Domestic Product is a key indicator reflecting growth across sectors; he adds that despite the failure of the Centre to provide T.N. its due share of funds, his govt. achieved an economic growth rate of 11.19%, which is double than that of the previous AIADMK regime

title: Allahabad HC refuses to quash FIR against singer Neha Singh Rathore over her social media posts
content: The High Court said Ms. Rathore’s posts were derogatory and disrespectful toward the Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Bengaluru techies, tech firms jittery as Trump announces massive H1-B visa fee hike
content: Industry leaders foresee a major shift in how companies, both in the U.S. and India, manage their talent

title: Manithaneya Makkal Katchi, Kongunadu Makkal Desia Katchi among 42 parties from Tamil Nadu de-listed by Election Commission
content: According to the Representation of People Act, 1951, if the party does not contest elections continuously for six years, it shall be removed from the list of registered parties

title: Political leaders spar over VHP advisory banning non-Hindus in Garba events
content: BJP Minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule says it is a ‘right’ while Congress leader Vijay Wadettiwar says the VHP wants to divide society over religion and reap political benefits out of it.

title: Watch: NCP’s Strategy for Maharashtra: Expansion, Unity, and Minority Inclusion | Pulse Maharashtra
content: Tune in to Pulse Maharashtra with Vinaya Deshpande for an in-depth conversation from Nagpur, Maharashtra’s political heartland

title: MHA calls next round of talks on Ladakh on October 6
content: A high-powered committee will hold talks with Leh Apex Body and Kargil Democratic Alliance, which demand Statehood for Ladakh and its inclusion under the Sixth Schedule (for tribal areas status) of the Constitution.

title: Karnataka proposes law to fix minimum wage, work hours for domestic workers
content: The preliminary draft of the Domestic Workers (Social Security and Welfare) Bill makes an agreement between employer and employee mandatory

title: On last day of Bihar Adhikar Yatra, Tejashwi seeks people’s support to change government
content: Out of 10 districts the Leader of the Opposition in the Bihar Legislative Assembly visited during the Yatra, six were Yadav-dominated — Jehanabad, Patna, Madhepura, Saharsa, Supaul and Vaishali

title: CJI Gavai faults judges’ conduct, says they must exercise their immense power with humility and responsibility
content: Gavai says conduct of some judges causing discontent in the Bar; adds both judges and lawyers should work together and that ‘no one is superior or inferior’

title: India capable of meeting domestic demand for SAF, exporting surplus: Government study
content: The study calls for urgent policy measures such as a the setting up of a SAF Council with high-level representatives from government departments and CEOs from relevant stakeholders to develop a vision and strategy for the domestic SAF sector

title: Some uncertainties likely due to U.S. decision on H-1B visas: HYSEA head
content: Over the last several years, IT services companies have been reducing their dependence on H-1B visa, says Prashanth Nandella, adding that there is bound to be pressure and necessitate reworking of business plans to an extent without impacting projects

title: Police rescue bus passengers stranded in overflowing water
content: Responding to a distress call, the Uyyalawada police undertake the rescue operation to save the passengers of a private bus

title: Reforms have transformed bureaucracy, says PM’s Principal Secretary P.K. Mishra
content: Moving beyond the limitations of annual assessment reports, the senior bureaucrat said the government had introduced a multi-source feedback system in 2016

title: Punjab’s kinnow growers anxious over water-logging following rains
content: The heavy rain this season has flooded orchards and raised the saline groundwater table in Fazilka and other districts, dealing a severe blow to the farmers

title: While good, ICMR impact scale may deter research in public interest
content: ICMR’s new IRIS scale promises a uniform way to weigh the impact of health research, but its reliance on publication-equivalents raises questions about fairness, priorities, and the ethos of science as a public good

title: We live at a time when fiction is treated as history to distort reality: Amarnath Ramakrishna
content: Mr. Ramakrishna contended that history could only be based on facts and not on literature; he said that those who attempt to fictionalise history use literature in defence, but excavations could never be fictionalised or modified

title: EHP parasite causes mass shrimp deaths, stunted growth in Godavari region, say SIFT experts
content: Officials advise farmers to fully harvest shrimp and let ponds dry for several weeks to eliminate the infection before restocking

title: Migrant workers from West Bengal face discrimination in housing, harassment over language, study finds
content: About 62.87% respondents cited better employment as the main reason for migration, and 60.23% said migration had adversely impacted their education

title: Best of Week 4: The joys of victory for Oklahoma, the agony of defeat for Florida, Clemson
content: Week 4 delivered clarity with cold, hard facts for some teams, while for others it proved there's more than meets the eye.

title: SEC calls out refs for missing OU's 'hideout tactic'
content: The SEC vowed "appropriate accountability" after it said officials failed to identify a "hideout tactic" on Oklahoma's second-quarter touchdown Saturday against Auburn.

title: Manning gets 'swagger back' as Longhorns roll
content: Arch Manning passed for 309 yards and three touchdowns in his sharpest game of the season as No. 8 Texas cruised to a 55-0 win over Sam Houston on Saturday.

title: Dabo wears pain on sleeve as Tigers drop to 1-3
content: Dabo Swinney wore his pain on his sleeve after Saturday's 34-21 home loss to Syracuse dropped Clemson to 1-3, his worst start as the Tigers' head coach.

title: Indiana hangs 63 on No. 9 Illini in statement win
content: Indiana broke the Big Ten's record for points against an AP top-10 opponent after dropping 63 in a blowout victory over No. 9 Illinois on Saturday.

title: Raleigh eclipses Griffey Jr. with latest record HR
content: Seattle Mariners superstar catcher Cal Raleigh broke Ken Griffey Jr.'s single-season franchise record for home runs with his 57th on Saturday.

title: Stanton making HOF case with 450th career HR
content: Giancarlo Stanton became the sixth player to hit his 450th career home run in a New York Yankees uniform in Saturday's 6-1 victory over the Baltimore Orioles.

title: New tush push vote not guaranteed, sources say
content: League sources told ESPN there are no assurances that the tush push will be brought up for conversation or a vote by the NFL this offseason.

title: 🏈 Viral 'Capt. Andrew Luck' account is back
content: Andrew Luck made his return to football in late 2024 in a surprising role, as Stanford football GM. As Luck returned, so did an old social media legend: Capt. Andrew Luck.

title: WWE Wrestlepalooza takeaways: AJ Lee is back, Rhodes primed to follow Cena's path
content: John Cena lost, AJ Lee returned and The Vision took care of The Usos. What does their future look like after Wrestlepalooza?

content: Memphis took a swing at Arkansas' razorback mascot while TCU had plenty of jabs ready for local rival SMU.

title: Last-minute prep for NFL Week 3: Stat trends, fantasy sleepers, upsets picks and more
content: Big week on deck for Romeo Doubs? Matchup advantages for Hollywood Brown? And the Eagles on upset watch? Catch up on Week 3 prep.

title: Man United find bite, Amorim system success to beat Chelsea
content: Man United were at their snarling best as Ruben Amorim's system appeared to click into place in Saturday's Premier League win over Chelsea.

title: Gravenberch leads the way for Liverpool, but they're not making it easy
content: Liverpool went ahead thanks to Ryan Gravenberch, but had to dig deep after letting Everton back into the game.

title: F1 chaos! Verstappen on pole, Piastri 1 of 6 crashes
content: Max Verstappen denied Carlos Sainz and Williams a shock pole position in one of the great Formula 1 qualifying sessions, featuring six red flags.

title: A'ja Wilson vs. Napheesa Collier: The moments that reshaped the WNBA MVP race
content: What appeared to be a foregone conclusion in July turned into a hotly contested WNBA MVP race. What changed?

title: Will Raleigh finish strong? Can Astros score without Alvarez? 5 things that will decide the AL West race
content: The Mariners and Astros are about to face off with the division title and playoff seeding on the line. Here's what will determine the race.

content: After a historic summer on the court and massive changes off it, Luka Doncic has sent a message to the NBA. And his new team responded in kind.

content: Just weeks after the Clippers shocked the NBA world by signing the 2019 NBA MVP, a feeling percolated across the organization: fear.

content: Can the Chiefs or Texans turn it around? Do the Bears have a chance in the NFC? Is the season already over for the Giants and Jets?

content: There are two words MLB and the MLBPA simply cannot agree on. Here's how it got this way and what it means for the next CBA.

title: 🏈 Why doesn't NFL every team use tush push?
content: The Eagles have converted the tush push 96.6% of the time on fourth-and-1, so why don't all teams use it? Here's why.

title: ⚾ Dodgers' Clayton Kershaw to retire after season
content: Clayton Kershaw, a three-time National League Cy Young Award winner and 11-time All-Star with the Dodgers, will retire after this season. "I'm at peace with it," he said. "I think it's the right time."

title: 🎤 Johnson: Not giving 'trade secrets' to Brady
content: Ben Johnson isn't worried about divulging information that can be used against the Bears when he participates in production meetings with Tom Brady.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United move for Forest's Anderson
content: Nottingham Forest's Elliot Anderson has emerged as a January target for Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Thompson, Bedard, Keller, others using 4 Nations snubs as Olympic motivation
content: NHL players will participate in the Games for the first time since 2014, with rosters revealed in January.

title: Fantasy basketball: Sleepers, breakouts and busts for 2025-26
content: Which fantasy basketball players are going to exceed expectations in 2025-26? Who will disappoint? Who is ready to take things to an elite level? Our experts list their picks.

title: Buy the dip: Thirteen players primed for bounce-back seasons
content: These fantasy hockey players underwhelmed last season, but could return to better production this year.

title: Get Pregnant In Our Hotels, Earn Rewards: Polish Hotelier Amid Falling Birth Rate
content: A Polish real estate group hopes to tackle the country's falling birth rate by rewarding clients who conceive babies in its hotels.

title: "Feared Being Executed": British Couple Released By Taliban
content: An elderly British couple released by the Taliban authorities after almost eight months in detention in Afghanistan arrived back in the UK on Saturday, telling the press that they feared "we would never be released".

title: "Paying Attention": DK Shivakumar As Bengaluru Fills Potholes After NDTV Report
content: Days after NDTV reported on the poor road conditions in Bengaluru, the Karnataka government has begun filling the potholes.

title: "Miracle": US Comedian As Audience Revives Man Who Suffered Heart Attack
content: Attendees performed CPR, checked his pulse, and called paramedics, keeping him alive for over five minutes until medical help arrived.

title: Shell Remains From Operation Sindoor Found During Cleaning Drive In Dal Lake
content: The remains of a shell that exploded in the Dal Lake during Operation Sindoor in May were found during a cleaning drive in the water body, officials said.

title: Nitish Kumar May Be Honest But His Ministers Looting State: Prashant Kishor
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar may be honest but his cabinet ministers and officers are looting crores from the people of the state, Jan Suraaj Party founder Prashant Kishor has told NDTV.

title: Tej Pratap Yadav's "Sudarshan Chakra" Warning Amid Row Over Sister's Post
content: Amid the suspense over a social media post by Lalu Yadav's daughter Rohini Acharya, her brother and the RJD patriarch's elder son, Tej Pratap Yadav, has said anyone who insults his sisters would suffer the "Sudarshan Chakra" of Lord Krishna.

title: 4 Arrested For Firing At Lucknow Mall After Fight With Bar's Security
content: A woman was among the four individuals arrested for allegedly firing a pistol at a mall in the Sushant Golf City police station area on Saturday, officials said.

title: "Aao, Ab Laut Chalen": Edelweiss CEO Radhika Gupta To Indians In US After H-1B Visa Fee Hike
content: Radhika Gupta, Edelweiss AML's Managing Director and CEO, said she wouldn't want to go back to the United States "at all."

title: "Has To Be For People Who Need It": Supriya Sule To NDTV On Reservation
content: Nationalist Congress Party (SP) MP Supriya Sule on Saturday said reservations should be only for people who "need it".

title: PM Modi To Visit Arunachal, Tripura Tomorrow, Launch Projects Worth Over Rs 5,100 Crore
content: PM Narendra Modi will visit Arunachal Pradesh and Tripura on Monday and lay foundation stones of multiple development projects worth over Rs 5,100 crore in Itanagar and inaugurate the development work of Mata Tripura Sundari Temple Complex.

title: Butter, Ghee, Ice Cream: Amul Slashes Prices Of Over 700 Products
content: In a statement, Gujarat Cooperative Milk Marketing Federation (GCMMF) announced revision in price list of more than 700 product packs, offering full benefit of GST reduction to its customers, effective September 22, 2025.

title: "We Want It Right Away": Trump Warns Taliban Over Bagram Airbase
content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday threatened Afghanistan with unspecified punishment if the Taliban-controlled country did not "give Bagram Airbase back."

title: Eknath Shinde's X Account Briefly Hacked, Hackers Post Pics Of Pak, Turkey Flags
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's 'X' handle was found to be hacked on Sunday, with hackers posting images of flags of Pakistan and Turkey, an official said.

title: PM's Mother Abused At Tejashwi Yadav Rally? BJP Shares Video, RJD Trashes It
content: Gaali politics is back in focus in Bihar. Weeks after Prime Minister Narendra Modi accused the RJD-Congress alliance of insulting his mother, late Heeraben Modi, the BJP has made a fresh charge that slogans abusing the PM's mother were raised

title: Woman's Half-Burnt Body Found In Tripura, Husband Blames MLA's Aides, 4 Arrested
content: The woman's husband alleged that three persons, including Manna Majumder, who is the nephew of BJP's Kakraban-Salgarh MLA Jitendra Majumder, severely assaulted him and his wife on Friday night.

title: 'No Overhaul' To 'Broken System': Musk's Flip-Flop On H-1B Visa Resurfaces
content: As US President Donald Trump's latest effort to overhaul the country's immigration system faces criticisms and becomes a flash point with the tech industry, his former ally Elon Musk's flip flop on the matter has resurfaced on social media.

title: Piyush Goyal Urges Industry To Pass On GST 2.0 Benefits To Consumers
content: Union Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal has urged industries to make sure they pass on complete GST rate rationalisation benefits to consumers, as India's indirect tax structure is set to undergo a massive transformation from September 22.

title: 'May Our Lives Be Filled With Light, Purpose': PM Modi Wishes Shubho Mahalaya
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday greeted people on the occasion of Mahalaya, which is observed before the start of Durga Puja.

title: Lucknow mall: Bouncer shot, many injured after party continued past closing time
content: A late-night dispute at a Lucknow mall's club escalated into violence when a group, including a doctor, clashed with bouncers after refusing to end their party. One of the men allegedly shot a bouncer, injuring him and a colleague. Enraged bouncers retaliated, assaulting the group. Police arrested four individuals and recovered a licensed pistol and ammunition.

title: PM Modi’s mother abused? BJP shares video of Tejashwi rally; RJD calls it doctored
content: Bihar's political scene is heating up again following accusations that Tejashwi Yadav's RJD rally insulted PM Modi's late mother, Heeraben Modi. This controversy follows similar allegations from Rahul Gandhi’s ‘Voter Adhikar Yatra’. BJP leaders have shared a video as evidence, while RJD denies the claims, alleging fabrication and audio manipulation by the BJP to defame Tejashwi Yadav.

title: Google's 'urgent' H-1B warning: Return to US and stay back; Read full memo
content: Google urgently advised its H-1B visa holders abroad to return to the U.S. immediately following President Trump's announcement of a $100,000 fee for new H-1B applications. The company cautioned against international travel for those in the U.S. on H-1B visas, citing potential re-entry complications under the new policy, and offered support for those unable to return before the deadline.

title: ‘No employer will pay $100K for me’: US H-1B visa fee hike sparks anxiety
content: A significant hike in US H-1B visa fees, potentially reaching $100,000 per employee, has sparked anxiety among Indian professionals and employers. Many Indians with scheduled visa stamping appointments are now in limbo, fearing they may be unable to return to their jobs in the US.

title: Exclusive | From taunts to World Champion: Minakshi Hooda, Indian boxing's new face
content: Minakshi Hooda, a 24-year-old boxer from Haryana, overcame societal skepticism and financial hardships to win a gold medal at the 2025 World Boxing Championships in Liverpool. Her victory not only brought pride to India but also inspired young girls in her village to pursue sports, proving that dedication and perseverance can shatter stereotypes.

title: Sam Altman's bold claim: 'People will lose jobs'; AI replaces support
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman predicts AI will soon replace customer service jobs, followed by programmers. While acknowledging potential job losses, he believes roles requiring human connection, like nursing, will remain. Industry experts express skepticism, with Gartner forecasting a reversal of support headcount reductions by 2027.

title: Eknath Shinde’s X account hacked; images of Pakistan, Turkey flags posted
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's X account was compromised on Sunday, with hackers posting images of Pakistani and Turkish flags. The incident occurred on the same day as the India-Pakistan Asia Cup match, prompting immediate action from cybercrime police. Authorities successfully regained control of the account within 30 to 45 minutes.

title: 'Did not publish on time': US flags Pakistan’s defence budgets; urges transparency
content: The US State Department's 2025 report urges Pakistan to enhance fiscal transparency by subjecting military and intelligence budgets to parliamentary oversight. While acknowledging progress in budget accessibility and auditing standards, the report criticizes limited debt disclosure and the absence of public access to executive budget proposals. These recommendations aim to bolster accountability and investor confidence amid Pakistan's fiscal challenges.

title: H-1B visa hike: JPMorgan asks staff to return to US before Sept 21
content: JPMorgan and Microsoft are urging H-1B visa holders to return to the U.S. immediately due to President Trump's new directive imposing a $100,000 annual fee on companies for each H-1B worker. This move, effective September 21st, is anticipated to disproportionately impact Indian IT firms like Infosys and TCS, who heavily rely on H-1B visas to deploy professionals in the U.S.

title: IND vs PAK: Should Arshdeep Singh play? Irfan Pathan questions India's plans
content: Irfan Pathan has sparked debate ahead of the crucial Asia Cup Super Four match between India and Pakistan, questioning whether Arshdeep Singh should be included in the playing XI. Pathan emphasizes the importance of a left-arm quick to partner with Jasprit Bumrah, especially under pressure and in wet conditions.

title: Watch: $100k H-1B visa fee triggers flight chaos in US among Indian travellers
content: Panic erupted among Indian H-1B visa holders in the US after President Trump's proclamation imposed a hefty $100,000 fee on petitions. Chaos unfolded at airports, with some passengers disembarking flights fearing reentry issues. Tech giants like Microsoft and Amazon reportedly advised employees to return to the US or avoid international travel.

title: Asia Cup clash: Ex-India captain slams Pakistan; calls them ‘seventh-division team’
content: Following Pakistan's loss to India in the Asia Cup 2025, Krishnamachari Srikkanth has strongly criticized the Pakistan team, deeming them a weak opponent. He suggested they should compete with Associate nations instead of top-tier teams, questioning their place in prestigious tournaments. Srikkanth also criticized coach Mike Hesson's leadership, doubting Pakistan's future progress under him.

title: Watch: Family in 1st AC caught stealing railway bedrolls
content: A video circulating online shows passengers on the Purushottam Express allegedly stealing bedrolls from the First AC coach, causing widespread condemnation. Railway personnel confronted a family accused of packing bedsheets and towels, leading to a dispute. This incident highlights a new challenge for Indian Railways, already struggling with overcrowding and cleanliness, as passengers reportedly steal onboard property.

title: Social media influencer Shahajahan Shareef arrested for defaming Bengaluru in video
content: A social media influencer, S Shahajahan Shareef, has been arrested in Bengaluru for allegedly spreading fake news and defaming the city. She posted an old video from Uttar Pradesh, falsely claiming it depicted rowdyism in Bengaluru, causing public concern. Police investigations revealed the video's origin, leading to her arrest and the seizure of her devices.

title: Chhattisgarh: 3 die of electrocution during kabaddi match in Kondagaon
content: In Kondagaon, Chhattisgarh, a tragic incident occurred during a kabaddi match in Ravaswahi village. Three individuals were electrocuted and three others sustained burn injuries when a spectators' tent accidentally touched a high-tension 11-kV power line due to a sudden storm. The deceased, identified as Satish Netam, Shyamlal Netam, and Sunil Shori, were residents of nearby villages, prompting ongoing investigations.

title: AIIMS NORCET 2025: Paper leak claims denied; official response here
content: AIIMS has denied allegations of a NORCET-9 2025 paper leak, clarifying that viral questions were only memory-based and not leaked exam material. An internal review confirmed the test’s integrity remains intact. Despite social media claims and technical glitches during Stage I, AIIMS assured that Stage II will proceed on 27th September 2025 with full transparency.

title: 'One dead, several injured': Shooting at New Hampshire country club - latest developments
content: A shooting at Sky Meadow Country Club in Nashua, New Hampshire, has resulted in one fatality and multiple injuries. Police have apprehended a male suspect, clarifying initial reports of two shooters as erroneous. Authorities confirm there is no ongoing threat to the public.

title: Asia Cup: Yashasvi Jaiswal opens up on snub - 'Decisions are in selectors’ hands'
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's exclusion from India's 2025 Asia Cup squad has stirred considerable debate, despite his impressive international record. While Shubman Gill returns as vice-captain, Jaiswal remains focused on self-improvement and future opportunities. He is set to participate in the upcoming Test series against the West Indies, aiming to contribute to the team's success.

title: Meteor shower or sat debris? Fiery streak dazzles Delhi-NCR skyline
content: A mysterious streak of light dazzled residents across Delhi, Noida, and Gurgaon, sparking speculation about its origin. Eyewitnesses reported a fiery trail fragmenting in the night sky around 1:20 AM on Saturday. While some suspected a meteor shower or satellite debris, a Grok comment suggested it could be space debris from a Chinese rocket re-entering the atmosphere.

title: 'Fed stale food, locked in room': Truck driver recounts 'torture' by Khedkar family
content: Prahlad Chauhan, a cement mixer truck helper, was allegedly abducted and held captive by the family of dismissed IAS officer Puja Khedkar after a road rage incident. He was confined, given stale food, and threatened for damage to their SUV.

title: Drop case against Zubeen Garg’s manager, says singer’s wife
content: Garima Saikia Garg, Zubeen Garg's wife, has made an emotional appeal urging the public and authorities to drop all FIRs against Siddhartha Sarma, Zubeen's close aide and manager. She emphasized Siddhartha's crucial support during Zubeen's health crises and the COVID-19 lockdown, highlighting his role as a brother to Zubeen. Garima stressed Siddhartha's importance in completing Zubeen's unfinished tasks.

title: 'Tensions peaked after property damage': US cops on Indian techie's ties with roommate
content: California police are investigating a possible link between an online post alleging racial discrimination and the fatal shooting of Mohammed Nizamuddin, a software engineer from Telangana. Nizamuddin, who was terminated from his job in February, reportedly attacked his roommate with a knife, leading to the police intervention.

title: 'How do you pack your life in less than 28 hours': Bengaluru H1-B workers in frenzy
content: A sudden Trump administration order triggered chaos in India, demanding H-1B visa holders return to the US within 28 hours. Many individuals attending family events or on personal trips faced immense pressure to book flights, fearing deportation or hefty fines. The abrupt announcement caused widespread panic and financial strain as people scrambled to comply with the unexpected deadline.

title: Asia Cup: Mohsin Naqvi steps in at ICC Academy; Pak turn to mind games before India clash
content: Following a contentious match, Pakistan is gearing up for another Asia Cup showdown against India. To alleviate pressure, the PCB has enlisted a motivational speaker and implemented a stress-management plan. Tensions remain high after a controversial first encounter, marked by India's victory and a subsequent handshake dispute, leading to PCB's demands and ICC's intervention.

title: Cannabis risk during pregnancy: Guidelines every mom should know
content: Recent studies and medical organizations, including ACOG, warn against cannabis use during pregnancy due to potential risks for both mother and baby. Cannabis use is linked to premature birth, low birth weight, and developmental issues. Experts recommend safer alternatives for pregnancy symptoms like nausea and anxiety, emphasizing that all cannabis products should be avoided during this critical period.

title: $100k for H-1B visa: 3-point clarification issued; fee doesn't apply to existing holders
content: The White House clarified that the newly announced $100,000 H-1B visa fee applies only to new applications, not renewals or existing visa holders. This clarification addresses widespread confusion following a presidential proclamation that initially sparked fears of urgent deadlines and potential disruption to the tech talent pipeline.

title: Early signs of prostate cancer men shouldn’t ignore
content: Prostate cancer is a prevalent health concern for men, particularly those over 50, often developing without noticeable symptoms in its early stages. Early detection through regular screenings like PSA tests and DREs is crucial. Changes in urination, pain, or sexual function should prompt immediate medical evaluation to improve treatment outcomes.

title: BCCI president: Who is Mithun Manhas? Ex-cricketer set to lead Indian cricket board
content: Mithun Manhas, former Delhi captain, is likely to become the new BCCI president. He is poised to be the first uncapped cricketer to lead the Indian board. Manhas brings administrative experience from the JKCA and a strong domestic cricketing background, including leading Delhi to a Ranji Trophy title in 2007-08.

title: Embassy on alert: India issues emergency number after Trump's H-1B fee order
content: The Indian Embassy in the US has launched an emergency assistance number for Indian nationals after President Trump imposed a $100,000 fee on new H-1B visa applications. This move, impacting a significant number of Indian tech professionals, has prompted the Indian government to study the implications and offer support. The government hopes the US authorities will address the disruptions caused to families and innovation ties.

title: NFL: Gracie Hunt shares heartfelt update with boyfriend amid Chiefs skid
content: Gracie Hunt, the Kansas City Chiefs' heiress, shared heartwarming photos on Instagram from a wedding she attended with her boyfriend, Derek Green. The couple, who have known each other since childhood through their families' connection to the Chiefs, looked deeply in love. Hunt expressed her views on love and faith in the post's caption, emphasizing its importance in daily life.

title: Lauren Kyle: NHL star Connor McDavid’s wife opens her cottage retreat
content: Lauren Kyle McDavid, wife of Edmonton Oilers captain Connor McDavid, is featured in ELLE Canada, showcasing her lakeside cottage. The interior designer, entrepreneur, and founder of Kyle & Co Design highlights a space that blends European elegance with modern simplicity, as her retreat reflects her love for entertaining. Along with thoughtful design details, she creates a warm, welcoming atmosphere.

title: Charlie Kirk’s assassination: Erika Kirk pulls Taylor Swift into controversy
content: Following Charlie Kirk's shocking assassination, his widow, Erika Kirk, has ignited controversy by involving Taylor Swift in memorial plans. Erika's ambition to outshine a Taylor Swift concert at Kirk's memorial event on September 21st has sparked outrage among Swift's fans.

title: Handshake row: Ashwin slams Pakistan, defends Pycroft – 'What's his fault?'
content: Former India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has defended match referee Andy Pycroft, criticising Pakistan for creating unnecessary controversy over the handshake issue after India's Asia Cup win. Ashwin highlighted that India had informed the referee in advance about their decision to avoid handshakes, accusing Pakistan of unfairly targeting Pycroft and demanding his removal.

title: 'Overwhelmed': Taylor Swift flooded with gown offers as wedding planning with Kelce begins
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are reportedly planning a deeply personal wedding, prioritizing intimacy over a grand Hollywood affair. Swift, overwhelmed by offers from top designers for her gown, is in the creative ideation phase. Kelce jokingly addressed wedding plans amidst football commitments, hinting at live music playing a central role.

title: Bihar polls announcement likely in first week of October
content: Bihar is bracing for state elections, likely in two phases starting early October, pitting CM Nitish Kumar's NDA against a determined opposition. Caste dynamics, intensified by the state's recent caste count revealing a significant OBC/EBC population, are expected to heavily influence the polls.

title: Oral microbes tied to higher pancreatic cancer risk: key factors and prevention tips
content: A recent NYU Langone Health study reveals a significant connection between oral microbes and pancreatic cancer risk. Specific bacteria and fungi in the mouth can more than triple the likelihood of developing this aggressive cancer. Maintaining good oral hygiene is highlighted as a potential preventive measure, alongside other lifestyle changes like avoiding smoking and maintaining a healthy diet.

title: Trout hits towering 485-foot shot for 400th homer
content: the three-time American League Most Valuable Player and 11-time All-Star hits his 400th home run . the 485-foot solo shot to left-center field off a 98 mph sinker from rockies reliever Jaden Hill extended the Angels' lead to 3-0 . Trout entered the season with 378 career homers .
